title: EastEnders fans fear Jay will die in dark storyline with his dad's evil killer
text:

EastEnders fans fear Jay Brown will die after a dark new storyline started tonight.

The ghosts of Jay's past came back to haunt him when his dad's killer turned up at the funeral parlour.

Callum Highway revealed the family of a "notorious" individual were expecting 200 people to line the streets waving flags and banners and form a guard of honour.

Jay was horrified when he looked into the open casket and saw Terry Bates - the gangster who stabbed Jase Dyer to death.

Back in 2008, Billy Mitchell famously hid in the bathroom while Terry and his thugs killed Jase after taking Jay hostage.

(Image: BBC)

(Image: BBC)

When Callum asked if Jay knew the man in the casket, Jay replied: "Know him? This is the man that killed my dad."

After ripping down the 'Brigade Boys' flag, Jay grabbed hold of Callum when he protested.

Jay added: "That man stabbed my dad and watched him die. No gold rings, no watches, no banners, no whisky, no 200 people clapping him anywhere.

"So don’t tell me what I can and can’t do, alright?"

(Image: BBC)

(Image: BBC)

Jay downed a bottle of whisky while sitting on the bench where he scratched his dad's name into over a decade ago.

Lola told him to let it go, but Jay realised he had not got justice for Jase's death if 200 people were clapping Terry off.

Meanwhile, Ben tried to let down Terry's wife but she issues a threat to ruin the funeral business.

(Image: BBC)

(Image: BBC)

Jay made a surprise return and agreed to arrange the funeral, but was secretly planning a revenge scheme.

Alone with Terry's lifeless body, Jay vowed to ensure everybody will discover the type of man Terry really was.

He warned: "So you can keep your watches and rings, they can clap you in, but the time this funeral is over and they all go home they’re gonna know it was for an old scumbag like you.

"They’re gonna hear what man you really were whether they like it or not."

(Image: BBC)

(Image: BBC)

EastEnders viewers took to Twitter after watching the dark scenes unfold.

One viewer said: "Really hope Jay doesn't end up getting killed off, he is a brilliant actor!"

"Past has come to haunt him so trouble time ahead," added another.

A third said: "Tonight poor jay his past childhood haunting him years later. The way jase was killed. FINALLY kicking off a storyline for this talented character."

"So happy that Jay finally has a storyline again. But also sad because it happens to be about his father's killer," said a fourth.

* EastEnders airs Mondays and Fridays at 8pm, and Tuesdays and Thursdays at 7:30pm on BBC One
description: The ghosts of Jay's past came back to haunt him when Jase's killer, Terry Bates, turned up at the funeral parlour
